bug.short_desc: Showing/hiding toolbar buttons is very broken

long_desc.thetext:
I am using a toolbar control, I have a bunch of buttons on there, split into multiple parts, and depending on a selection, I want to show or hide certain items. This doesn't square with the toolbar overflow handling, and as far as I can tell, there are a number of issues:
- The toolbar._recalculateOverflow() method is not called when a toolbar button changes visibility (my buttons are in a Part, but judging from the code, it doesn't matter).
- Even if toolbar._recaculateOverflow() were called, it uses getSizeHint() to do its calculations, which does not take into account if a a widget is hidden. Again, in my case, this affects Parts. A Part.getSizeHint() may say 500px for 4 buttons, even if only one of the buttons is visible, meaning the Part will not be created/shown despite there being space available.
- If all of a Part's toolbar buttons are hidden, the part still takes up space, which makes no sense and causes the UI to look bad.
